structure.purpose: This is the definition for the ImagingStudy resource

definition.short: A set of images produced in single study (one or more series of references images)
definition.formal: Manifest of a set of images produced in study. The set of images may include every image in the study, or it may be an incomplete sample, such as a list of key images.

mapping.map: Reference IHE radiology TF vol 2 table 4.14.1

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.formal: The base language in which the resource is written.
definition.comments:
Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource

Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

definition.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
definition.formal: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
definition.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

definition.formal: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
definition.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

definition.formal: Date and Time the study took place.
Who the images are of.
Formal identifier for the study.
Accession Number.
Other identifiers for the study.

definition.short: Order(s) that caused this study to be performed
definition.formal: A list of the diagnostic orders that resulted in this imaging study being performed.
definition.comments:
The order(s) can be inferred from information such as accession numbers, but the details of this depend on local workflow management. 
Note that there is a many-many relationship between orders and studies.

definition.short: All series.modality if actual acquisition modalities
definition.formal: A list of all the Series.ImageModality values that are actual acquisition modalities, i.e. those in the DICOM Context Group 29 (value set OID 1.2.840.10008.6.1.19).

binding.name: ImagingModality
binding.description: Type of acquired image data in the instance

definition.formal: The requesting/referring physician.
Availability of study (online, offline or nearline).
WADO-RS URI where Study is available.
Number of Series in Study.
Number of SOP Instances in Study.
Diagnoses etc provided with request.
Type of procedure performed.
Who read study and interpreted the images.
Institution-generated description or classification of the Study (component) performed.

definition.short: Each study has one or more series of instances
definition.formal: Each study has one or more series of image instances.

definition.formal: The number of this series in the overall sequence.

definition.short: The modality of the instances in the series (0008,0060)
definition.formal: The modality of this series sequence.

binding.description: Type of data in the instance

definition.formal: Formal identifier for this series.
A description of the series.
Sequence that contains attributes from the.
Availability of series (online, offline or nearline).
WADO-RS URI where Series is available.
Body part examined. See  DICOM Part 16 Annex L for the mapping from DICOM to Snomed.

binding.description: Codes describing anatomical locations. May include laterality

definition.formal: When the series started.

definition.short: A single instance taken from a patient (image or other)
definition.formal: A single image taken from a patient.

definition.short: The number of this instance in the series (0020,0013)
definition.formal: The number of this image in the series.
Formal identifier for this image.
DICOM Image type.
Type of instance (image etc) (0004,1430).

definition.short: WADO-RS service where instance is available  (0008,1199 > 0008,1190)
definition.formal: WADO-RS url where image is available.
definition.comments: Each instance may have a url and an attachment. Both represent the same information, but using different approaches. The URL is a reference to a WADO-RS service that makes the instance available.

definition.short: A FHIR resource with content for this instance
definition.formal: A FHIR resource with content for this instance.
definition.comments: Each instance may have a url and an attachment. Both represent the same information, but using different approaches. The attachment is a reference to a FHIR resource (Media, Document, etc).

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)

searchParam.name: _language
searchParam.documentation: The stated language of the resource

searchParam.name: accession
searchParam.documentation: The accession id for the image

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: The date the study was done was taken

searchParam.name: series
searchParam.documentation: The series id for the image

searchParam.name: size
searchParam.documentation: The size of the image in MB - may include > or < in the value

searchParam.name: study
searchParam.documentation: The study id for the image
